channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
channel.description:
This role was partially inspired by psychoneirik's Accused. The Senex is a neutral who has a varied goal of either requiring the BD faction to win, ergo siding with them, or requiring them to lose, thus allowing him to side with either the Unseen/Cult or the Neutral Killer. The main idea behind the Senex is that since he is automatically confirmed via Teachings, but only himself knows his alignment then he must be dealt with social deduction and social deduction only. If he ends up being aligned with the Blue Dragon and is executed on trial or by the Prince, then the faction will pay heavy penalties for it. However his abilities allow him far more potential then only a vote and if evil he must be dealt with as soon as possible.
> # [color = "Peachpuff"] The Senex [/color] > **[color = "gray"] Neutral Support [/color]** **Mentorship (Passive)** - The Senex is immune to death at night and will have a 50-50 chance of starting aligned with the Blue Dragon or against them. If the Senex is aligned with the Blue Dragon, then he will lose his night immunity after the third night. **Beloved Mentor (Passive)** - If the Senex wins with the Blue Dragon, his attributes will be: >* If he is executed on trial, then all Blue Dragon-aligned players who did not vote for a pardon will be occupied in the coming night and will have their immunity to occupation bypassed. >* If he is killed by a Blue Dragon-aligned killing role, excluding the Prince, then they will die of guilt. >* If he is killed by the Prince, the Prince will lose all of their executions. >* If he is executed by the King, then the King will die of guilt if he is also a member of the Blue Dragon. > >**Teachings (Day)** - Hides the user's whispers for the day. - Infinite uses **Mind Reader (Day)** - Learns the target player’s alignment. If they are not Blue Dragon then the Senex learns of their exact class. Can only be used if the Senex is against the Blue Dragon and can be used in the same day along Teachings. - Infinite uses **Traditional Herbs (Night)** - Heals a player, preventing them from dying to night and cures poison and bleeding. The target player will also be seen as a member of the Blue Dragon to faction checks. Cannot be used on the same player two nights in a row and can be used on the user. - Infinite uses **Ancient Tonic (Night)** - Causes the targeted player to be night and occupy immune for the current night allows them to bypass healing, night immunity, occupation immunity, and redirection immunities. - 1 use *Has a random goal of either A) See the Blue Dragon win or B) See the Blue Dragon defeated.*
* Neutral, survival, you know the drill with Mentorship. The BD-aligned Senex loses night immunity so scum can counter him. * Beloved Mentor is needed as without harsh penalties for executing a BD-aligned Senex, people will obviously throw social deduction away in favor of Neuts Out. * As much as I hate easy confirmation, Teachings is necessary as the entire point of the class is to deduce the proven Senex's alignment, and also helps coordinate with evils. Adding fakeclaiming here would just complicate issues and Senex fakeclaims would be a pain to get rid of due to the risks associated with executing a real one. * Mind Reader is used to find allies for his night abilities. Both night abilties should be usable in the same day to prevent the court from demanding the Senex to always use Teachings to prevent using Mind Reader. * Both his primary and secondary night abilities have effects of similar strength to scum and BD alike, allowing him to support well regardless of his alignment.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
Overall tuned down the penalties for killing/executing a BD-aligned Senex along with reducing his one-use ability to a single night. There are still penalties for executing this class, albeit it’s not as bad as the previous iteration.

Solic had a pretty good point which convinced me to tone down the mislynch penalty. A poorly playing Senex would be downright catastrophic to BD by no fault of their own, so I readjusted so that BD doesn’t get screwed up just due to a neutral playing terribly, albeit the penalties are still there due to preventing people from just executing them due to neuts out.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
If getting him killed through lynch makes you so worried. He can just fake a Physician or Alchemist claim. I think you are giving him way too much power and significance. You also buff the evil version a lot if BD gets penalized so much for getting rid of him. Beloved Mentor should just be completely removed in my opinion or be similar to the GK’s/fool’s passive.

I mean there are plenty of games where a Good King Order executes the prince. You think something similar will not happen with the Senex? I would not want to get penalized for bad Senex play so heavily.

You also haven’t addressed how swingy it is. This can be an extra number for the evil faction with a frenzy like ability, can hide MM, can vote with them, can identify neutrals so they do not get converted/killed, can heal them from NK/king OE/knight attacks and he has death immunity himself.

I made the comparison with the old allies king, because to me you just altered it slightly and made it a neutral spawn with about equal power level. It should not be on the same power level as a king, because they typically are elected and are a huge focal point in throne of lies. Adding another “king” just dilutes that. Starting king is also already what you want, which is a class that has to be scumread to find out alignment.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
Solic:

This is basically allies king reskinned into a “neutral” class, but instead of extra voting power he gets more powerful guards and some skills that are more suited into benefiting evil.

He can heal/tailor and give a shot of 2 night and occupy immunity along with guaranteed night actions. His kit balances out towards pro and anti BD. His kit benefits evils more than the EK as the EK doesn’t really have anything to help evils at night.

Solic:

He has Mind Reader, which is a daytime allies that is stronger if king is evil.

Only if he’s evil, otherwise he only has Teachings. The evil version needs Mind Reader to work otherwise he won’t have any targets for his night abilities as scum won’t out themselves unlike BD.

Solic:

He has Traditional Herbs and Mentorship, which is overall an upgraded guards, since he “guards” himself and can do more than guard someone else.

Mentorship’s immunity goes away if he’s BD, so he’s vulnerable to evils attacking him mid-late game and later.

Solic:

Beloved Mentor is unnecessary, they should have to work hard to show that they are BD

The issue here is that if there is nothing to discourage BD from mislynching him then people are just going to lynch him for no reason because of neuts out. The entire point of the Senex is to be a class that like the King, needs to have its motivations deduced via social deduction instead of being mechanically confirmed.

Solic:

Just imagining an evil king with a sorcerer a sellsword and an evil Senex is a nightmare though. He should most definitely be unique too.

This issue should be taken with the role generator. Right now King+Neuts is still extremely swingy as a game can have a EK+Sorc+Scorned+SS while another can have a GK+Merc+2xAlchs.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
This is basically allies king reskinned into a “neutral” class, but instead of extra voting power he gets more powerful guards and some skills that are more suited into benefitting evil.

He is confirmable as Senex with Teachings, as was King by virtue of being king.

He has Mind Reader, which is a daytime allies that is stronger if king is evil.

He has Traditional Herbs and Mentorship, which is overall an upgraded guards, since he “guards” himself and can do more than guard someone else.

Lastly he has Ancient Tonic, which counts as a replacement for the King’s voting abilities.

My thoughts on it are that I miss allies king, so I would like this class, however in its current form it is extremely overpowered. Beloved Mentor is unnecessary, they should have to work hard to show that they are BD if they have a daily unoccupyable faction check that does not compromise any other ability of theirs like not being able to guard for old king. Teachings should be private matter clone instead. It is confirmable in the same way, but this allows him to work with evils more freely. Just imagining an evil king with a sorcerer a sellsword and an evil Senex is a nightmare though. He should most definitely be unique too.

Largest issue is how swingy he would be, because of his power level. Do you not think that the alignment of the Senex has way too much of an influence on who likely would win the game?

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Senex
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
This role was partially inspired by psychoneirik’s Accused. The Senex is a neutral who has a varied goal of either requiring the BD faction to win, ergo siding with them, or requiring them to lose, thus allowing him to side with either the Unseen/Cult or the Neutral Killer. The main idea behind the Senex is that since he is automatically confirmed via Teachings, but only himself knows his alignment then he must be dealt with social deduction and social deduction only. If he ends up being aligned with the Blue Dragon and is executed on trial or by the Prince, then the faction will pay heavy penalties for it. However his abilities allow him far more potential then only a vote and if evil he must be dealt with as soon as possible.

The Senex

Neutral Support
Mentorship (Passive) - The Senex is immune to death at night and will have a 50-50 chance of starting aligned with the Blue Dragon or against them. If the Senex is aligned with the Blue Dragon, then he will lose his night immunity after the third night.
Beloved Mentor (Passive) - If the Senex wins with the Blue Dragon, his attributes will be:

  • If he is executed on trial, then all Blue Dragon-aligned players who did not vote for a pardon will be occupied in the coming night and will have their immunity to occupation bypassed.
  • If he is killed by a Blue Dragon-aligned killing role, excluding the Prince, then they will die of guilt.
  • If he is killed by the Prince, the Prince will lose all of their executions.
  • If he is executed by the King, then the King will die of guilt if he is also a member of the Blue Dragon.

Teachings (Day) - Hides the user’s whispers for the day. - Infinite uses
Mind Reader (Day) - Learns the target player’s alignment. If they are not Blue Dragon then the Senex learns of their exact class. Can only be used if the Senex is against the Blue Dragon and can be used in the same day along Teachings. - Infinite uses
Traditional Herbs (Night) - Heals a player, preventing them from dying to night and cures poison and bleeding. The target player will also be seen as a member of the Blue Dragon to faction checks. Cannot be used on the same player two nights in a row and can be used on the user. - Infinite uses
Ancient Tonic (Night) - Causes the targeted player to be night and occupy immune for the current night allows them to bypass healing, night immunity, occupation immunity, and redirection immunities. - 1 use
Has a random goal of either A) See the Blue Dragon win or B) See the Blue Dragon defeated.

  • Neutral, survival, you know the drill with Mentorship. The BD-aligned Senex loses night immunity so scum can counter him.
  • Beloved Mentor is needed as without harsh penalties for executing a BD-aligned Senex, people will obviously throw social deduction away in favor of Neuts Out.
  • As much as I hate easy confirmation, Teachings is necessary as the entire point of the class is to deduce the proven Senex’s alignment, and also helps coordinate with evils. Adding fakeclaiming here would just complicate issues and Senex fakeclaims would be a pain to get rid of due to the risks associated with executing a real one.
  • Mind Reader is used to find allies for his night abilities. Both night abilties should be usable in the same day to prevent the court from demanding the Senex to always use Teachings to prevent using Mind Reader.
  • Both his primary and secondary night abilities have effects of similar strength to scum and BD alike, allowing him to support well regardless of his alignment.
